result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Joshua D. Griswold

defendant.name: Griswold, Joshua D.
defendant.address: N7256 County Road I, Juneau, WI 53039

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
14CF402, 15CF162, 15CT191 Defendant Joshua D. Griswold in court with attorney Bradley J Jansen.  Kurt Frederich Klomberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court reviews charges and penalties, def pleads guilty to 14CF402, guilty to ct. 1 in 15CT191, court finds pleas made FVKI court accepts plea and finds def guilty on 14CF402, 15CT191, ct. 2 is dismissed on 15CT191, 15CF162 is DRI, state heard, defense counsel heard, defendant waives statement, court heard and sentence imposed.  

14CF402
TAD DPA

15CT191
5 days in the DCJ w/huber and transfer to comm on or before 7/17/15
VIP w/in 120 days
AODA assess and follow thru
$1379 fine including costs to be paid w/in 60 days or time allotted for a payment plan or contempt sentence of 28 days w/huber and transfer consecutive
12 mo rev
12 mo ign int

14CF402, 15CF162, 15CT191 Attorney Bradley J Jansen appeared.  Atty Klomberg appears for the state.  Defendant does not appear, defendant had the matter miscalendared.  Atty Jansen heard, Atty Klomberg heard, court goes off the record, back on the record, defendant will appear later this afternoon.

w/15CT191:   Defendant shall not use/possess/control any controlled substances (without a valid prescription therefore) or drug paraphernalia, nor be in the presence of anyone who does.  Defendant shall not consume alcohol or other intoxicants.  Defendant must maintain absolute sobriety  and shall not go upon the premises of any establishment whose primary business activity involves the sale or distribution of alcoholic beverages, including bars, taverns, liquor stores and beer tents.  Defendant shall not operate a motor vehicle unless he has a valid Wisconsin driver's license.  Defendant shall have his/her fingerprints and photographs taken at the Dodge County Sheriff's Department, Jail Division. Def. must submit to any request by law enforcement of breath test or urinalysis while on bail.

14CF402, 15CF162 (Initial) & 15CT191 (Initial): Defendant Joshua D. Griswold in court with attorney Bradley J Jansen.  Kurt Frederich Klomberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Address is 226 N. Depot Street, Juneau, WI 53039; Court quashes prior warrant; Court conducts Initial on 15CF162, review of complaint, Court finds PC; Court conducts Initial on 15CT191; review of complaint; Court finds PC; Atty. Jansen notes that Def. needs to go to SPD and will need to be appointed on 2 new cases; waive time limits as to 15CF162; discussion on scheduling; State heard on bond: requests absolute sobriety from alcohol and drugs and OWI conditions; Court orders $500 PA BOND: absolute sobriety, no bars; no drugs, etc.; not operate without valid DL, Def. must submit to request by law enforcement of breath test or urinalysis while on bail; Def. again told to go to SPD after signing bond/booking; waive time limits; PH set 7/30/at 1:30pm in Br. 4; State also wants IPTSC set for all cases prior to PH date; Court sets all 3 cases for IPSTC 8/6/15 at 1:15pm (1 hour)
9:07 Def FTA, state requests warrant, court finds probable cause and issues warrant.
